Svengali invites you in his castle in the hearth of Kyoto

100 years after Svengali's legendary parties, we keep the spirit alive by reviving the gathering

See the Location

The House of Curiosities, an unique immersive experience

The company Abra-Cadabra, creator of the well acclaimed experimental cocktail lounge in Kyoto, L’Escamoteur Bar, invites you to experience their second chapter.

The House of Curiosities offers a unique theater experience, a strange, intimate, and freaky cabaret where boundaries between the stage and audience vanish.

Each evening, Svengali hosts various talented artists, making each night in central Kyoto unique and cinematic.

Step into the world of Svengali, a transformative journey blending circus, the world of magic and storytelling.

Read our Rules and FAQ

How to get to Svengali Castle?

Svengali

ＰＬＥＸＵＳ, 7th Floor, Nakagyo Ward, Bizenjimachō, 〒604-8023 Kyoto, Japan

Access

Metro
  • Gion-Shijo / Sanjo Station (Keihan Line)
  • Kyoto-Kawaramachi Station (Hankyu Line)
  • Sanjo Station (Tōzai Line)
BUS
  • Shijo Kawaramachi Bus Stop by Frequent City Bus lines
Get the Direction on Google Maps

Svengali’s Rules

IMPORTANT MESSAGE

  • Admission is for 16 and above.
  • Svengali is not responsible for any accidents, injuries, or damages at our venue.
  • The mask and cloak provided at the Castle must be worn during the show.
  • No walk-ins — online reservations only.

Frequently Asked Questions

At what time the gathering is starting?

Doors open 30 minutes before the show. Please arrive no later than, 20 minutes before it begins.

Can I enter after the show started?

No, once the show starts, the doors will be closed and unfortunately no one will be allowed to enter after that point.

It is important to arrive before the show begins to ensure you have a seat and don’t miss any part of the performance. This show is a journey with story-telling, and to fully experience the narrative, it is crucial to be present from the beginning.

Please plan to arrive early to avoid any inconvenience.

I don’t have reservation is walk in ok?

Seriously? Are you checking this question?

We wrote it everywhere for you!

No, walk-ins are not allowed because is a reservation-only system.

Please make sure to secure a reservation in advance to attend the show.

Is the show every night the same?

No, the gathering is different every night. We are pleased to present top-level artists, Including world champions and most of them are medalists. The show always feels special, as we host both Japanese and international guest artists. Each evenings offers a unique experience!

What language is the storytelling?

The story will be told in both Japanese and English.

However, the show is designed to be enjoyable and talk-free, so regardless of language, the experience will be captivating and accessible to all.

Is there any dress code to attend the gathering?

No, there isn’t a specific dress code for attending the gathering.

However, we really encourage people to enjoy the event and come in their best outfits to make it a memorable occasion! As part of this gathering, you’ll experience an immersive event where you are the guest of Svengali.

Mask have to be worn during the show?

Yes, masks are an integral part of the story and the gatherings of Svengali, so they must be worn during the show.

Additionally, a robe or cape will be rented to you for the occasion and must be worn.

All our masks are handcrafted by talented artisans in Venise and are disinfected after each use to ensure they are bacteria-free.

I wear glasses can I have a mask?

Yes, we will provide masks specifically designed for glasses users. They are made to be comfortable to wear, ensuring you can enjoy the show without any discomfort.

Is there better seat for tall persons?

Yes, it is preferable to reserve a seat on the 1st floor. You will find it more comfortable.

Do I have to pay extra for the drinks?

No, cocktails and champagne are included in the entry price.

Is it possible to drink while having a mask on?

Yes, our mask are designed for you to enjoy also your drinks during the event.

Is kids allowed to the show?

The minimum age required for the show is 16 years old, so unfortunately, kids are not allowed to attend.

Can I smoke at the venue?

No, smoking is not allowed at the venue.

I have some allergies what should I do?

Please inform our staff when arriving at the venue. We will always double check at the entrance with you anyway.

Is any facilities for wheelchair?

No, unfortunately, the venue and facilities are not arranged or equipped for wheelchair accessibility.

What should I expect to see?

You can expect an incredible experience with amazing artists offering something truly different. The show invites you to enter the unknown, embarking on a transformative journey that takes you from darkness to light.

Svengali

ＰＬＥＸＵＳ, 7th Floor, Nakagyo Ward, Bizenjimachō, 〒604-8023 Kyoto, Japan
